com.jack.dicewars.dice_wars.game

Class TerritoryBorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jack.dicewars.dice_wars.game.TerritoryBorder

  • public class TerritoryBorder
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Jack Mueller on 2/25/15. A Territory Border is a model fabrication that encapsulates internal Territory data when it is not needed. A TerritoryBorders responsibilities revolve around how many other Territories (which actually means TerritoryBorders, it is connected to.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int EDGE_CORNER_COUNT 
      static int EDGE_EDGE_COUNT 
      static int EDGE_MAX_COUNT
      The exact number of Territories the internal Territory touches.
      static int EDGE_MID_COUNT 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TerritoryBorder(int edgeCount)
      Creates a TerritoryBorder with an internal Territory that is owned by NullPlayer and has no dice on it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TerritoryBorder

        public TerritoryBorder(int edgeCount)
        Creates a TerritoryBorder with an internal Territory that is owned by NullPlayer and has no dice on it. This constructor does not connect this object to any other TerritoryBorders.
        Parameters:
        edgeCount - How many TerritoryBorders can a Player get to from this TerritoryBorder.

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighbors

        public Territory[] getNeighbors()
        Returns:
        The TerritoryBorders this object is connected to.

      • setNeighbors

        public void setNeighbors(Territory[] neighbors)
        Parameters:
        neighbors - Sets the TerritoryBorders that are reachable from this object.

      • getInternal

        public Territory getInternal()
        Returns:
        The Territory that is encapsulated by this TerritoryBorder.
